body_html:
@ezyang I'm pretty comfortable saying "If the build system has changed in such a drastic and subtle way that (1) the generated make/ninja files are no longer valid AND (2) the change is such that the generated makefile/ninja file doesn't know that it should trigger a re-cmaking, then a setup.py clean or git clean is in order."

edit: if that strikes you as a bad idea, we can just toss this whole diff - I guess the blessed way to iterate will be to use rebuild_libtorch anyway, so it doesn't matter much if this "slow" path is doing a bunch of extra cmaking

edit: if that strikes you as a bad idea, we can just toss this whole diff - I guess the blessed way to iterate will be to use rebuild_libtorch anyway, so it doesn't matter much if this "slow" path is doing a bunch of extra cmaking
body:
@ezyang I'm pretty comfortable saying "If the build system has changed in such a drastic and subtle way that (1) the generated make/ninja files are no longer valid AND (2) the change is such that the generated makefile/ninja file doesn't know that it should trigger a re-cmaking, then a `setup.py clean` or `git clean` is in order."

edit: if that strikes you as a bad idea, we can just toss this whole diff - I guess the blessed way to iterate will be to use `rebuild_libtorch` anyway, so it doesn't matter much if this "slow" path is doing a bunch of extra cmaking
